result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Josiah G Noeldner

records.addlTxt:
9:48 AM Defendant Josiah G Noeldner in court.  Attorney Rachel Allison Robole in court for Josiah G Noeldner.  Prosecuting Attorney Afton Brianna Lewis in court for the State of Wisconsin. State in compliance with victim notification requirements. There is an agreement. 
Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count 1: Disorederly Conduct as a Domestic without the Use of a Dangerous Weapon. Defendant is advised of charges, maximum penalties, elements of the crime(s) and constitutional rights. Court accepts plea and withholds the finding of guilty. Deferred Acceptance of Guilty Plea filed with the court. 
DPAH: 10/26/2023 at 9:30am
Anything else is ordered dismissed and read in.
Deferred prosecution agreement hearing scheduled for October 26, 2023 at 09:30 am.
Deferred prosecution agreement hearing on October 26, 2023 at 09:30 am.

Hearing scheduled for October 26, 2022 at 09:30 am.

9:38 AM case called. Prosecuting Attorney Afton Brianna Lewis in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Josiah G Noeldner in court with Attorney Rachel Allison Robole. Attorney Robole states there is a DAGP agreement, but the Defendant needs time to talk with the coordinator.
Hearing scheduled for September 14, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Letter to defendant with amended signature bond ordered by court 6/30/2022. Request to return signed bond and Affidavit of Witness form to Clerk of Court no later than 7/11/2022.

Conditions:
Contact allowed with J.N. through telephone and other electronic means.
No acts or threats of violence against anyone.

Court order to amend bond and conditions of bond to remove the condition of no contact with J.N., and add the condition of contact with J.N. through telephone and other electronic means. All other conditions of bond shall remain in effect until further order of the Court.

10:00am Prosecuting attorney Andrew James Gunderson in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Josiah G Noeldner in court.  Attorney Rachel Allison Robole in court for Josiah G Noeldner. Defense does not have an offer on this case. 

Settlement Conference (by phone) with District Attorney's Office (715-839-4828) on 07/13/22 at 1:15pm
Hearing scheduled for August 3, 2022 at 09:30 am.
